sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Thealma and Clearchus a pastoral history, in smooth and easie verse / written long since, by John Chalkhill, Esq., an acquaintant and friend of Edward Spencer. Chalkhill, John, fl. 1600. Walton, Izaak, 1593-1683. Flatman, Thomas, 1637-1688.
[6], 168 p.
Printed for Benj. Tooke ..., London : 1683.
Some copies of the same date read Edmund Spencer instead of Edward Spencer. The preface is dated May 7, 1678 and signed: J.W. [i.e. Isaac Walton]. "To my worthy friend Mr. Isaac Walton" is dated June 5, 1683, and signed: Tho. Flatman. Reproduction of original in Yale University Library.
=======
Thealma and Clearchus a pastoral history, in smooth and easie verse / written long since, by John Chalkhill, Esq., an acquaintant and friend of Edward Spencer. Chalkhill, John, fl. 1600. Walton, Izaak, 1593-1683. Flatman, Thomas, 1637-1688.
[6], 168 p.
Printed for Benj. Tooke ..., London : 1683.
Some copies of the same date read Edmund Spencer instead of Edward Spencer. The preface is dated May 7, 1678 and signed: J.W. [i.e. Isaac Walton]. "To my worthy friend Mr. Isaac Walton" is dated June 5, 1683, and signed: Tho. Flatman. Reproduction of original in Yale University Library.
Benj. Tooke
